name: euphorbia

a large and varied group of flowering plants grown in gardens, belonging to the spurge family: Keep euphorbia out of gardens where children play, and wear gloves when handling. Some of the euphorbias we cultivate in our gardens are versions of native wild plants.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the large flower bed, I grew hellebores, euphorbia, and tulips.Euphorbias come in huge variety, from ground cover to towering trees.Under the strong reds, the greeny golds of Euphorbia robbiae look good.
